header.description: This is a site on all the data that your browser knows about you.

intro.heading: Your digital fingerpring
intro.content1: Hi, I'm Nando Mu침oz, welcome to Your browser says..., a site with the only intention of show you the value of your privacy in internet.
intro.content2: The information showed is data delivered by your browser every day in every site visited, even you have disabled browser's permissions.. They are not 100% exact, but compared with other types of data they are able to establish your Digital fingerprintig.
intro.content3: Next, I showed you a dashboard, part of the information that you give to every web visited. If you want to know more, read my post about it (Only Spanish sorry 游뗴)

main.noSupport: Your browser does not support this functionality. Good for your privacy, may be :D

aboutme.heading: About me
aboutme.content1: I'm Nando Mu침oz, senior Frontend Developer expert in the technology @CommerceCloud | #ecommerce | #CSS lover and member of the NGO @HelpDev_
aboutme.content2: You can contact me by Github,Twitter or Linkedin

footer.title: Status of your data
footer.content1: All data appears on this website remains stored only on your device,never will be stored in a external server, why? because I'm not interested in your data, I'm interested in your awareness.
footer.content2: However, I don't know if GitHub (the server where this website is hosted) or ipapi.co (external API that I use to determine your city, country and telephone company from your IP) generate any type of data storage similar or unrelated to shown on this website. But hey, if you are not worried about sharing every dinner, moment, memory or feeling on Facebook, you will not be worried about the information (similar to this) or this wonderful recommended by your friend about to watch streaming movies, but for free :D irony :)
footer.thanks: I want to thank Robin Linus for his inspirational work and the icons by Flaicons
footer.license: MIT License:Basically, you can do whatever you want with software licensed under the MIT license - only if you add a copy of the original MIT license and copyright notice to it.
